reviews.review:
Beautiful to look at (as expected), yet apparently the time gap between Frozen I & II allowed space enough for hyper-politcal emotional writers to ruin everything. 

How about a super emotional and self-indulgent Anna (same personality defects from first movie) who cares nothing for consequences (including the destruction of her entire village!), as long as it feels right to her. 

How about Elsa's storyline ending with the realization that the ultimate thing in life is YOURSELF?! Nothing higher or greater than you is possible - YOU are the god in your own story. 

Let's make Kristoff into a beta male whose only purpose is to support Anna in her mania ("my love isn't fragile" - insinuating that a REAL man takes backseat to his destructive & illogical female partner). 

Rounding out with the over-arching theme of white civilization = bad, indigenous forests dwellers = good. 

Illogical feminists have ruined another family favorite through their attempts at indoctrination. We were not the only parents who stopped several times during this movie to look around at each other with a silent "did they really just do that?" 

Parents, pay close attention to the themes you need to undo with your children if you allow them to see this.
Its a good family movie with a lot of songs.
Never expect two much on an animated sequel.  However this one has heart.  The story line is nice and the music is great too.

Not the worse movie ever but not great either. Suffers from the same issues as the first movie only its magnified here. Pacing is slow, characters are dull, and things happen in the movie without any real explanation except for the movie wants it to happen. I'd say the first is a better movie but this one is at least more rewatchable.
I was surprised that it was so good even though it was a sequel.  Good story.  Wonderful music.  With seeing.
I like how it has introduced characters, brand new songs, including Lost in the Woods, and the post-credit scene.
Love the movie!!! Really good message, not only for kids but for everyone for life!!!!!!  I do think there were too many songs, but u can clearly tell, which one or ones will be Oscar contenders.
Cute Holiday movie, although a bit scary at times for the little ones.  Elsas songs from Frozen I were a little catchier to sing along with.  Still a great family movie, Id recommend it!!

As a Disney Fanatic, I couldn't wait to see Frozen II. In my opinion it was probably the best sequel to any Disney movie!! The music was just as good as the first movie. Now I get to talk about it to my Granddaughter who saw it the day before I did!! Definitely a MUST see!!

A more adult vision of Frozen, with quite adult themes, melancholy songs, and quite heart-wrenching moments.  Meanders a bit at the beginning, but one it begins to focus, it's very enjoyable.  My daughter and I both loved it.
